law.catch_line: Setting fires in forest protection district; permit.

text.section:
Sec. 14-21. Setting fires in forest protection district; permit.
It is unlawful for any person to carelessly burn or cause to be burned or to set fire or cause fire to be set to, any forest, grass, woods, wild lands or marshes within a forest protection district, unless written permission shall have first been received from a duly appointed Fire Warden or other person authorized to issue such permits.
